Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: deprecate package not reported when dotnet build/list package" (#10299) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

When I deprecate a nuget package version on nuget.org, `dotnet build`/`dotnet list packages --deprecated`/`dotnet list package --vulnerable` not reported this package version



### Repro Steps

1. deprecate a nuget package version on nuget.org
2. reference the deprecated version in a project
3. run `dotnet build`/`dotnet list packages --deprecated`/`dotnet list package --vulnerable` to see whether there's a warning

### Expected Behavior

It should report warning since the package version is vulnerable

### Screenshots


![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f1cfcbeb-af9d-4053-bbac-3c6e44f94751)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d1a8f8d-cb88-4d3c-96f0-1866f37760b2)


### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[MR2024-12-05] dev to main" (#10298) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "[OIDC 9] Add allow list for Entra ID tenants acceptable for federation" (#10287) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/10212.
Depends on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/10286.

This PR adds an allow list of Entra ID tenants which can be used for token exchange. This allows us to carefully control federation as we role the OIDC feature out. Starting out, we will only allow first party, internal Entra ID tenants. Third party users will likely wait on GitHub Actions integration.

This allow list will be used during token validation and (in a future PR) in the UI to create federated credential policies.

If `all` is specified in the configuration, all Entra ID tenants are allowed. This is the default for local development but in production we will have one or more tenant ID GUIDs specified. Multiple values are separated by semicolon `;` as implemented by [`StringArrayConverter`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/main/src/NuGet.Services.Configuration/StringArrayConverter.cs).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[SDKMigration] Update Gallery.CredentialExpiration to use ManagedIdentity" (#10297) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Update Gallery.CredentialExpiration job to use Managed Identity for storage access.
This changeset also includes changes to add a new setting for local development.

Adding "Local_Development": boolean to the top level of app.json will now inject the relevant TokenCredential for use (DefaultAzureCredential for local development true, and ManagedIdentityCredential for local development false).

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: 'Alternate package' field should be clearer that it requires a Package ID" (#10294) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

I recently deprecated a package.  Tried to add a link to an alternate package and received this message:

 Could not find alternate package 'https://www.nuget.org/packages/mypackage'.

Link to alt package was in the format: https://www.nuget.org/packages/mypackage

### Repro Steps

Select a package to deprecate.
Find an alternate package on nuget.org and copy the link.
Paste the link in the Alternate Package box on the deprecation page.
Note the error message.

### Expected Behavior

Should be able to add a link to an alternate package

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update docs following change in default to NuGetAuditMode" (#13946) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Version conflict with Nuget.Frameworks.dll in .Net SDK 9.0.101" (#13987) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

NuGet.Framework.dll 9.0.101

### Worked before?

sdk 8.0.307

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

i use roslyn libraries to analyze my project.
after update my project to net9, roslyn code has stopped working.

some code to reproduce the issue:

```
var solutionFilePath = "c:\myPath\mySolution.sln";
var projectName = "MyProject";

using (var workspace = MSBuildWorkspace.Create())
{
   var solution = await workspace.OpenSolutionAsync(solutionFilePath);
   var project = solution.Projects.FirstOrDefault(p => p.Name.Equals(projectName));
   if (project == null)
   {
       HandleError($"Progetto {projectName} non trovato nella solution!");
       return null;
   }
   var compilation = await project.GetCompilationAsync();

  //after call to project.GetCompilationAsync if i watch workspace.Diagnostics 
  //it give me a lot of errors relative to assembly NuGet.Frameworks (see verbose log section)
}
```

errors are like 'Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet.Frameworks, Version=6.12.2.1'

NOTE: the references version of NuGet.Frameworks library is 6.12.1.1

the version it not found because simply DOES NOT EXIST (6.12.1.1 is the last one available on nuget)

these errors cause all the code analysis to fail...

a similar issue is this one: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/13746 who is closed but NOT RESOLVED: the workaround suggested (using the old framework version) does NOT WORK with a project compiled in NET9.

any help?

Thanks




### Verbose Logs

```shell
[Error] Msbuild failed when processing the file 'C:\ARTInvoiceManager\ARTInvoiceManager.Server\ARTInvoiceManager.Server.csproj' with message: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\9.0.101\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk\targets\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.FrameworkReferenceResolution.targets: (90, 5): errore imprevisto dell'attività "ProcessFrameworkReferences".
System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet.Frameworks, Version=6.12.2.1, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (0x80131040)
File name: 'NuGet.Frameworks, Version=6.12.2.1, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'
 ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\9.0.101\NuGet.Frameworks.dll'. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (0x80131040)
File name: 'C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\9.0.101\NuGet.Frameworks.dll'
   at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromAssemblyPath(String assemblyPath)
   at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.ResolveUsingLoad(AssemblyName assemblyName)
   at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.Resolve(IntPtr gchManagedAssemblyLoadContext, AssemblyName assemblyName)
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ProcessFrameworkReferences.<>c.<AddPacksForFrameworkReferences>b__233_0(ITaskItem item)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ArraySelectIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.IEnumerableWhereIterator`1.ToList()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ProcessFrameworkReferences.AddPacksForFrameworkReferences(List`1 packagesToDownload, List`1 runtimeFrameworks, List`1 targetingPacks, List`1 runtimePacks, List`1 unavailableRuntimePacks, List`1& knownRuntimePacksForTargetFramework)
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ProcessFrameworkReferences.ExecuteCore()
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.TaskBase.Execute()
   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Execute()
   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.ExecuteInstantiatedTask(TaskExecutionHost taskExecutionHost, TaskLoggingContext taskLoggingContext, TaskHost taskHost, ItemBucket bucket, TaskExecutionMode howToExecuteTask)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bug in "packageSourceMapping" ignores pattern" (#13983) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Visual Studio 17.12.3

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Example:

1) Create nuget Package called "Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" and add it to your nuget feed in Azure DevOps with nuget package Version "1.0.0.0". Version must be below the current Version of "Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" on nuget.org.
2) Install package from private Azure DevOps feed in your C# project.
3) Create nuget.config with "packageSourceMapping". Like this

``` xm
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>  
	<packageSources>
		<add key="MyFeed" value="privatedevopsaddress/mycollection/_packaging/myfeed/nuget/v3/index.json" />
		<add key="MyFeed2" value="privatedevopsaddress/mycollection/_packaging/myfeed2/nuget/v3/index.json" />
		<add key="MyFeed3" value="privatedevopsaddress/mycollection/_packaging/myfeed3/nuget/v3/index.json" />
		<add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
	</packageSources>

  <packageSourceMapping>
		<packageSource key="MyFeed">
			<package pattern="Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" />
			<package pattern="MyFeed.*" />
		</packageSource>
		<packageSource key="MyFeed2">
			<package pattern="MyFeed2.*" />
		</packageSource>
		<packageSource key="MyFeed3">
			<package pattern="MyFeed3.*" />
		</packageSource>
		<packageSource key="nuget.org">
			<package pattern="*" />
		</packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
  
</configuration>
```
and add it to your nuget packagemanager in Visual Studio.
4) Open nuget package manager in Visual Studio 2022.
5) Go to tab "Updates".
6) Change package source to "All"


What you get: It will show that there is a new update for "Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" in nuget feed "nuget.org".
What you expect: No new updates because "Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" is now mapped to the private feed "MyFeed" and not to nuget.org.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "System.Text.Json 8.0.4 has security vulnerability" (#13857) at NuGet/Home
